turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about 2006 Detroit Tigers season.
turn.1: Who was the best pitcher during the 2006 season?
turn.2: Rookie Justin Verlander won the AL Rookie of the Year Award, and fellow starters Kenny Rogers, Jeremy Bonderman and Nate Robertson, as well as rookie reliever Joel Zumaya, all had noteworthy seasons.
turn.3: Was there any bad spots during the season?
turn.4: There was concern when starter Mike Maroth had to undergo surgery early in the season, but his replacement Zach Miner proved to be adequate.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: The Tigers' newfound success attracted a new generation of fans, many of whom who had never seen winning baseball in Detroit before.
turn.7: Did they have any other records?
turn.8: Detroit hit 16 home runs in their first four games, the most ever by any team in their first four games of the season.
turn.10: Tigers fans traveled to road games in large numbers, most notably at the interleague series with the Chicago Cubs at Wrigley Field from June 16–18.
turn.11: What did the fans do at Wrigley?
turn.12: The crowd could be heard chanting "Let's Go Tigers!" throughout all three games, all of which were Detroit victories.
